remarks:
2012-Oct-02 14:37:22 by pfc:
All of the daemon logs, pstree output, etc. as of this afternoon is captured in ~pfcouvar/condor-badness-10000 on ldas-pcdev1.ligo.caltech.edu, which Todd should have login access to.

2012-Oct-03 12:26:19 by nwp:
This seems like this could be related to #3156. If one of the local universe jobs completes, and the schedd tries to restart one of the "copies", you will get a similar error message. But, I notice the schedd's are different machines...
2012-Oct-25 17:52:16 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070806 to v070807 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2012-Dec-19 09:30:47 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070807 to v070808 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2013-Mar-05 08:23:08 by pfc:
Just to confirm, is this stalled because you can't figure out how it could have happened, and we can't reproduce it on demand?

2013-Mar-11 11:10:06 by gthain:
Thanks to the eagle eyes of our LIGO friends, who caught this in action before schedd logs rolled over, we can see what happened: At:

3/10/13, at 14:45:45, it looks like there was a problem with NFS on pcdev2:

03/10/13 14:45:45 (pid:17173) warning: setting UserUid to 5517, was 5294 previously 03/10/13 15:38:03 (pid:17173) Error: chdir(/mnt/zfs3/stochastic/S5_Recolored_aLIGO/condor) failed: No such file or directory

Note the warning at 14:45:45 is superflous, but it looks like the chdir to /mnt/zfs3/stochastic/S5_Recolored_aLIGO/condor took almost an hour before it failed. Perhaps there was a different filesystem causing the hang between there? In any case, the schedd was blocked for 53 minutes.

Then, a rather large amount of backlogged work started happening, and the schedd noticed that it had not heard from any of its children in the CHILD_ALIVE timeout, and killed them all, assuming that they were hung. While this is merely annoying for children of the schedd which are shadows, it is really bad for the local universe starters, as it just kill -9s them, so there's no chance for the starter to clean up the job.

We'll have to think about the right way in HTCondor to fix this, but in the short term, on the submit machine, you should be able to set

NOT_RESPONDING_TIMEOUT

to some very large value. The default is 3600 (seconds), perhaps 10x that would fix your immediate problems.

2013-Mar-28 17:16:00 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070808 to v070809 using ./ticket-target-mover.
check_ins: 2013-Jun-27 17:29   Check-in [36706]: Fix LIGO found problems related to local universe blocking on NFS #3244 (By Greg Thain )
creator: pfc
